title: How to Find Your XBox 360 Serial Number

steps.headline: Look on the back of your Xbox.
steps.description: Look near the A/V,HDMI,I/O(USB) and Ethernet ports.

steps.headline: Find a sticker near these parts.
steps.description: The sticker will have a barcode on it.

steps.headline: There should be bold numbers followed by words.
steps.description: For example: MFR Date (Manufacture Date, the date when your XBox was made) .

steps.headline: Look under the MFR Date.
steps.description: You will find your Xbox 360's Serial Number.

steps.headline: Open up the USB port in the front of your console.
Look for a sticker with a number.
steps.description: This should be the serial number.

steps.headline: It will display your Serial Number.
On the bottom of the Xbox 360, you will be able to see the Xbox 360 manufacturing date and the Xbox 360 serial number.
steps.description:
The manufacturing date is in the following format: 
2008-11-03
YYYY-MM-DD (Year-Month-Day,) which is the date according to ISO 8601.

steps.headline: Unravel the code.
steps.description:
The serial number looks like this: 6144526 84302. The serial number is formatted (LNNNNNN YWWFF). L the number of the production line within the factory,
NNNNNN the number of the Xbox within this week. Y the last digit of the production year,
WW the number of the week of the production year
FF is the code of the factory (02: Mexico, 03: Hungary, 05: China, 06: Taiwan).

steps.headline: Put it altogether.
steps.description:
Taking the serial number 6144526 14302 this would give you: 
Line 6 of the factory
This would be 144526 off the production line
2008 production year
Week 43 of the year
Factory location Mexico.

text:
Checking the back Look on the back of your Xbox. Look near the A/V,HDMI,I/O(USB) and Ethernet ports. Find a sticker near these parts. The sticker will have a barcode on it. Look above that barcode.  There should be bold numbers followed by words. For example: MFR Date (Manufacture Date, the date when your XBox was made) . Look under the MFR Date. You will find your Xbox 360's Serial Number. Checking the USB portal Open up the USB port in the front of your console.  Look for a sticker with a number. This should be the serial number. Checking System Information Go to System Information.  It will display your Serial Number.  Cracking the code - LNNNNNN YWWFF On the bottom of the Xbox 360, you will be able to see the Xbox 360 manufacturing date and the Xbox 360 serial number. The manufacturing date is in the following format: 
2008-11-03
YYYY-MM-DD (Year-Month-Day,) which is the date according to ISO 8601. Unravel the code. The serial number looks like this: 6144526 84302. The serial number is formatted (LNNNNNN YWWFF). L the number of the production line within the factory,
NNNNNN the number of the Xbox within this week. Y the last digit of the production year,
WW the number of the week of the production year
FF is the code of the factory (02: Mexico, 03: Hungary, 05: China, 06: Taiwan). Put it altogether. Taking the serial number 6144526 14302 this would give you: 
Line 6 of the factory
This would be 144526 off the production line
2008 production year
Week 43 of the year
Factory location Mexico.
